abstract: Ukrainian government, hastening to secure debt relief with support of International Monetary Fund, is strongly urging reluctant investors to accept big losses to gain bailout; Ukrainian authorities, observing events in Greece, do not want to end up in a similar, seemingly endless, struggle with creditors.
lead_paragraph: In a bid to avoid continuous negotiations with creditors, the Ukrainian government (with the I.M.F.’s support) is deep in debt talks, pressing investors to accept a bailout deal — but investors are resistant.

headline.main: Mindful of Greece, Ukraine Is in a Rush to Line Up Debt Relief
headline.print_headline: Mindful of Greece, Ukraine Is in a Rush to Secure Debt Relief

snippet: In a bid to avoid continuous negotiations with creditors, the Ukrainian government (with the I.M.F.’s support) is deep in debt talks, pressing investors to accept a bailout deal — but investors are resistant.
